alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 5:50AM EST until January 03 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Anson, Chatham, Cumberland, Davidson, Durham, Edgecombe, Forsyth, Franklin, Granville, Guilford, Halifax, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Nash, Orange, Person, Randolph, Richmond, Sampson, Scotland, Stanly, Vance, Wake, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are ongoing across central North Carolina as an area of low pressure and cold front cross the region. A widespread two to three inches of rain are expected through today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
